content: Is there a Python equivalent for the short-form "if" in C++? For example, how could the following C/C++ code be written in Python? `a = (b == true ? "123" : "456")`

Yes, Python has a similar conditional expression that can be used to achieve the same functionality as the ternary operator in C++. In Python, the expression is written as:

```python
a = "123" if b else "456"
```

In this Python expression, if `b` evaluates to `True`, `a` will be assigned the value `"123"`. Otherwise, `a` will be assigned the value `"456"`. This is a concise way to perform conditional assignments in Python, similar to the ternary operator in C++.
